Armies.name: Armies
Armies.text:
This module uses the built in army actor type. Since 1.0.0, the workaround implementation has been removed.

Recruitable Armies

To make armies show up in the Recruit Army window, import the actor from the compendium into a folder called Recruitable Armies and make the players the owners. Custom actors will also be picked up if those conditions apply.

By default, it is assumed that army tokens are unlinked (Prototype Token -> Identity -> Link Actor Data = unchecked). This means that all changes made on the actor in the actor sidebar are synced to all tokens on all scenes, unless they are overridden. You can override data by double-clicking on the token itself and make changes on that sheet.

If you wish to link actor data instead so that editing a token on a scene and in the sidebar changes the same data, you need to change the prototype token property, copy the recruited army and move it out of the Recruitable Armies folder.

Custom Tactics

By default, all tactics lower than the army's level that support the armies type are listed in the train army browser. If you wish to add your own tactics, simply create an Item of type "Campaign Feature" in your items tab and set the following things

  • Campaign: Kingmaker

  • Category: Army Tactic

  • Traits (under the name input): Infantry, Siege, Cavalry or Skirmisher

Automation Notes

Kingdom Sheet:

  • Consumption is automated by summing up all consumption values of all visible tokens across all scenes. If your actor is unlinked, it will be calculated on by token basis, otherwise it will only be calculated once per actor

Kingdom Building.name: Kingdom Building
Kingdom Building.text:
Homebrew Built-in Changes

  • Based on James Jacob's answers, event XP is bumped to 40XP from 30XP and the event modifier acts as a level modifier for the XP Awards table

  • Based on James Jacob's answer Settlement Level is calculated by taking the number of blocks with at least one structure in it

  • Deliberate Planning had its Status Bonus changed to a Circumstance Bonus. Reasoning for that is that not a single leadership activity grants a status bonus, it's all Circumstance Bonuses. Plus a +1 Status bonus is obsolete from level 1.

  • Using a similar line of reasoning, Kingdom Feats provide Circumstance Bonuses instead of Status Bonuses; if you want to use Status Bonuses, you can choose the Status Bonus variants (or V&K alternatives)

  • Occult Shop ups the limit for Occult and not Magical items in your settlements

  • Worksites need to be in a claimed hex to be counted.

Vance & Kerenshara Integration

Vance & Kerenshara Homebrew (and the subsequent 1.1 addition) adds a multitude of adjustments and fixes to Kingdom Building. The module allows you to opt into many changes using the Config button on the Kingdom Sheet, except for the following:

  • Construction Time will not be implemented (use a journal)

  • Renown will not be implemented (use a journal)

  • No changes to the turn structure is made; you are expected to simply reuse the existing structure and keep action cost in mind (2 actions for Retrain and checks with skills that you are not specialized in)

  • Similarly no visual help is provided for keeping track of available actions during the activity phase (3 for PCs, 2 for NPCs) nor for remembering the additional civic actions granted by a Town Hall (1), Castle (2) or Palace(2) (which I advise you don't use unless you want to increase kingdom turn length even more)

Official Adventure Integration

  • By default, the Kingdom Sheet uses data from the main hexmap scene if enabled; this means that claimed hexes, worksites and farmlands will be populated correctly from your hex map

  • Placing armies onto scenes that are owned by the players will automatically update update their consumption on the sheet

  • There is no support for the buildings shipped with the official module since they don't cover many areas (infrastructure, V&K & home brew)! Instead, this module ships its own structures; those are automatically linked to the Foundry built-in token images.

Kingdom Sheet

The Kingdom sheet auto-calculates almost everything related to kingdom building. You launch it exclusively with the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-macros.Macro.1LmPW2OlHgJvedY8]{View Kingdom} Macro.

On first launch, it copies an actor with the name Kingdom Sheet into your actors folder. This actor is used to store the sheet data and can be placed anywhere but you must not change its name. Then proceed with configuring the sheet:

  1. Edit the Kingdom Sheet actor's permissions in Foundry's Actors tab by right clicking on the kingdom sheet actor. Set every PC as Owner if you want them to change values on the sheet, otherwise choose Observer

  2. Fill in the details in the Status tab. Leaders need to be drag and dropped from the actors sidebar and must be either a Character or NPC. If you are playing with the companion guide, make sure to set the appropriate invested bonus (or the leader type drop down when using V&K Leadership Bonuses)

  3. Configure your hex map in the Status tab:

    First you need to decide which method you use for tracking kingdom size, worksites and farmlands. By default, the Official Module is configured. You can set the preferred method in your kingdom sheet settings:

    • Official Module: take worksites, farmlands and kingdom size from the official module's hex map

    • Manual: manually configure your worksites, farmlands and kingdom size in the Status tab

    • Tile/Drawing Based: associate selected drawings/tiles with meta information using the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-macros.Macro.tsqRp4OXdkrzRajS]{Edit Realm Tile/Drawing} macro; claimed hex tiles/drawings placed on a configured scene increase your size, worksite and farmland tiles placed inside the claimed hex tiles/drawings increase their respective values. The example image below shows drawings that were made using the Draw Polygon tool and have a pattern background image configured.

      • View your hexmap scene, then scroll to the bottom of the Status tab and click the Set Stolen Lands Hex Map to Current Scene

      • Edit the Scene configuration: in the Basics tab, change Permissions from GM Only to All Players

  4. Set the appropriate skill proficiencies in the Skills and feats in the Feats tab.

  5. Import or create a capital settlement scene. This module ships a few example scenes that come with pre-configured settlement block tiles. If you wish to use your own scenes, be sure to read up on how automatic block tile calculation is implemented in the Settlements and Structures section further below!

  6. Import all structures from the Structures compendium

  7. Drag and drop the Townhall structure from Foundry's Actors tab onto a block in your capital scene

  8. While viewing your capital scene, go into Settlements tab and click Add Current Scene.

  9. Edit the added settlement and change the Type to Capital

Now you are able to run your first kingdom turn. Change to the Turn tab.

Actions flow from top to bottom if they are numbered. the ? buttons will open the activities description. If there are more than 1 button per line, you need to make a choice.

Make sure to set the Active Settlement in the sidebar to the settlement the PCs are in or where the kingdom event to resolve takes place. At the end of the Kingdom Turn, hit the End Turn button. This will move all values in their Next columns to their Now ones.

Settlements

Settlements are created as scenes on which you can place structure tokens. Before being able to use a settlement, you first need to add it to your Settlements in your kingdom sheet. First, change to the Settlements tab, then click Add Current Scene

This module ships a Settlement Scenes compendium which contains 5 settlement types:

  • One with no water borders

  • 4 with 1-4 water borders

All scenes come with block tiles, onto which you can place your structures. These tiles use a special flag to not accidentally consider your own tiles as blocks. You can place them on your own scenes by simply copying it over and modifying them to your liking.

You can resize the tiles, change their background image, but you must not rotate them. Only rectangular shapes will work. The module ships a 1x4 and 4x1 tile at the same location as the 2x2 image that you can use to spice things ups.

By default, placing a structure into a block automatically increases the settlement's level. If you do not want this kind of automation, you can turn it off in the kingdom sheet settings. You can also disable it on per scene basis in the settlement configuration.

Structures

Structures are implemented as NPC stat blocks, including the correct sizes. Their description is in the public notes. You will need to import all structures from the Structures compendium to make them show up in the Build Structure activity popup. The module will include all structures in your game in that window, so you can create custom structures as well.

All structures in a settlement can be automatically summed up and calculated and can be viewed in your settlements tab by clicking the Inspect button.

Settlement level is calculated by placing structure tokens on special block tiles that are included in the Settlement Scenes compendium. If you wish to use your own scenes, import a single scene, copy the block tile to your own scene and, if required, change the background image.

You can set the Slowed condition after a Build Structure Failure to indicate that construction is delayed. It will be excluded from all modifier calculations.

If you want to home brew structure rules, you can use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-macros.Macro.DNVjHLroQKfN8y4V]{Edit Structure Rules} Macro.

A guide on structure rules can be found in the GitHub Repo and requires the use of JSON.

Automation Notes

  • Many Kingdom Feats are not fully automated. You can check that by taking a look at the Auto column in the Feats tab. Details are visible by hovering over the (x) symbol with your cursor.

Combat Tracks.name: Combat Tracks
Combat Tracks.text:
The CRPG ships with various combat tracks that depend on the region. If Combat Tracks are enabled, it tries to find a playlist in the following order:

  1. Combat playlist of the first actor with a playlist on the combat tracker (Configurable via @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-macros.Macro.sFJkolazth08xYOH]{Set Combat Playlist} Macro by selecting a token)

  2. Combat playlist of the active scene (Configurable via Set Combat Playlist Macro by not selecting a token)

  3. Combat playlist of the current region (configured in the Camping Sheet)

If any playlist is found, at the start of combat, that playlist is played and the active scene's playlist is disabled.

Afterward, the games active scene's playlist is started again.

If you wish to quickly disable combat tracks, e.g. when fighting a boss, you can use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-macros.Macro.qmj42STqKK89f5Sh]{Toggle Combat Tracks} Macro.

Official Adventure Integration

If you are using the official module, the default and region combat tracks are auto-configured for you after opening the camping sheet for the first time, but you can still override the mechanism by creating the appropriately named playlists

Camping.name: Camping
Camping.text:
Usage

The basic idea of the sheet is to make camping incredibly fast by:

  • keeping previous camp assignments & meal choices
  • showing players and GMs if all activities have been performed
  • automatically managing Camping and Meal effects
  • automating resource management like rations and ingredients
  • allowing you to easily override degrees of successes

First, drag the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-macros.Macro.GXeKz3qKlsoxcaTg]{Camping} Macro into your macro bar and run it once. This will create an actor called Camping Sheet in your actor directory. Do not rename or delete it since it will be used to store and retrieve data. The data is persisted on the actor's flags property which is not visible to users by opening the default actor sheet.

Adding Camping Actors

To add actors to your camp, drag and drop them onto the actor list.

You can add the following actors:

  • characters

  • npcs

  • vehicles

  • loot

but only characters will be able to perform checks and consume meals. Because effect syncing is a very slow process, it is highly discouraged to add all companion actors to the sheet. Instead, enable their activities in the sheet's settings. The only companion activity that can't be enabled that way is Camp Management (because it requires a check). Simply add the companion for that specific activity if required.

Important: Note, that users can't drag and drop their own actors from the sidebar by default, so the GM needs to pre-populate it.

Hexploration and Time Tracking

The sheet automatically calculates your hexploration activities based on the speed of your party actor. You can override the minimum speed by setting the Minimum Travel Speed in the sheet's settings (e.g. 40 to simulate horses).

Clicking the hex icon will advance or retract 1 Hexploration Activitiy. Remaining Hexploration Activities are shown in Hex. Activities and are calculated based on the time listed in Adventuring. Passing even a single second at the start of the day will therefore reduce your Hexploration activities as RAW.

Random Encounters

Random encounters are managed at the very top by selecting the region drop down and changing the Encounter DC modifier if necessary. They are automatically rolled during rest but can be rolled during the day as well by clicking on the skull and dice button. If you don't want to perform a flat check hit the skull button instead.

Roll Tables are configured in the sheet's region configuration.

Keep in mind that the Encounter DC is not only modified by the encounter modifier, but also by chosen activities like Blend into the Night.

The rules mention that you increase the Encounter DC for each hour spent during camp and perform a random encounter check. This is widely regarded as a mistake and therefore isn't automated. If you wish to follow RAW, you need manually increase the modifier and check for encounters.

Out of the box, the official module only ships combat encounters. If you want to roll non combat encounters as well, you can use a Proxy Random Encounter Table which is configured in the sheet's settings. The proxy table can roll on subtables based on a formula or the configured roll table for the current region by setting Result Type to Text and Result Details to Creature.

Prepare Campsite

When you open up the sheet, the only activity that can be chosen is Prepare Campsite. Drag an actor from the actor list:

onto the Prepare Campsite Tile:

To fill the activity. After rolling the check, a Failure, Success or Critical Success automatically advances the sheet to the Camping Activities section and syncs the effects. Otherwise clicking on the > button will immediately move to the Eating section. Because no actor had the chance to cook a meal, all meal buttons will be disabled.

You can track existing campsites on a hex map by setting a Hexploration Scene in the sheet's settings. This will save the current party token position and Prepare Campsite degree of success (other than Critical Failure) on the map. If you prepare campsite in the same hex again, you will be asked whether you want to reuse a previous result.

Camping Activities

In order to perform camping activities, you have to set Prepare Campsite to a result other than Critical Failure or -. Otherwise the > button will jump straight to Eating.

To select camping activities, drag and drop your actor from the actor list onto an activity tile. Actors that do not fulfill the minimum proficiency requirements can't select the activity. You can disable this behavior in the settings.

Most of the existing activities are hidden and can be enabled in Activities in the sheet's settings.

After an activity result has been chosen, its effects are automatically applied to PCs. For this reason you want to complete actions like Tell Campfire Story before performing other activities. You can also quickly choose a different result. The previous effects will be removed if necessary, new ones will be applied immediately.

Some actions like Amiri's Enhance Weapons only apply to combat and can't be easily applied to PCs. The will be posted to chat if a random encounter happens during rest.

If you want to simulate companions taking their actions while in camp, you can enable their activities in the settings to prevent cluttering the activity section. Toggled activities will always be enabled and filtered from the activity selection section.

Eating

Each character in camp is available in the Eating section where you can choose their food for the day. To select a meal, simply drag and drop your actor from the top actor list onto a meal. It will remove the actor from whatever meal was chosen before.

Favorite Meals are configured in the sheet's settings menu. Only actors owned by each PC will be available for selection, but keep in mind that all actors listed in the popup will be updated on a save, potentially overriding saved values from other players. Ideally, no actor is owned by more than one character, but if that's the case, players will need to open the favorite meal popup one after another.

Subsist is automated as a Macro: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-macros.Macro.0NhBWcZQf1GHp73f]{Subsist: Provisions} which will add an item called "Provisions" to your inventory. Those items are consumed before Rations and are removed after Resting.

Spells like @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Mt6ZzkVX8Q4xigFq] or other features that create rations can be handled by running the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-macros.Macro.7MrkVVB6D6UrdtA1] Macro. This macro adds a set number of Provisions to the party actor. If you want to automate this, you can set a minimum subsistence in the settings which is added after resting.

If a PC has chosen the Cook Meal activity and Prepare Campsite wasn't a Critical Failure, you will be able to perform the check by clicking on the roll button; otherwise the form elements are disabled. Rolling a check will automatically fill in the degree of success and post the buttons to consume ingredients and apply effects to chat. Contrary to camping activities, meal effects are not automatically synced to PCs, because they persist beyond your camping session and because they can stack. For example: you could suffer the Critical Failure from Discover Special Meal and then consume a Basic Meal.

The total amount of all carried ingredients and the total amount of consumed ingredients for uncooked recipes (recipes without a result) is listed to the right. There is no automation in place to prevent you from consuming more ingredients than you carry.

Resting

Rest duration is affected by the following parameters:

  • Number of all actors in camp that are enabled in the watch rest settings, plus
  • Increase actors keeping watch rest setting, plus
  • 1 if Organize Watch was a Critical Success, plus
  • Fish-on-a-Stick rest duration effects
  • Guns To Clean setting (affects Daily Preparations)

You can start a rest by hitting the Begin Rest button.

If you've set a playlist it will be played. If you want to play it only once, then set the Playback Mode to Soundboard Only.

By default, one random encounter will be rolled automatically during rest. This can be changed to one every 4 hours (RAW) or none in the sheet's settings. If an encounter occurs, a random point in time between now and the end of the rest will be chosen and time will automatically advance to that point in time. Afterward, a random camping character who is not marked to Skip Watch in the sheet's settings will prompt you for a secret Perception check. All companion activities that impose effects on enemies or allies will be published to chat

Once you finish the random encounter, you can continue the rest by pressing Continue. No more random encounters will happen. Time will advance to after your daily preparations.

Then the following things happen:

  • All camping effects will be removed
  • All meal effects that expire after resting will be removed
  • All damaging or healing meal effects will be rolled and, if possible, applied automatically
  • The Rest for the Night macro will be executed for all actors in the sidebar
  • Additional healing received from Basic Meal and Healers's Blessing will be applied as will Shepherd's Pie's halving on a critical failure. Doubling and halving healing will cancel out, regardless of how many effects would apply.
  • All Provisions items will be removed
  • All camping activity results are reset to -
  • The Adventuring tracker will be reset

Automation Notes

Meal effects and consumables such as rations are tracked by their name, so if you rename Rations, ingredients or effects, tracking will be broken. Compared to RAW, the following rules are not automated:

General

  • The encounter DC modifier is not being increased/decreased/reset automatically. Many people have issues with frequency and likelihood of random encounter checks, so we leave this up to the GM.
  • For a similar reason, time is not advanced automatically when performing camping activities
  • The rules mention that each PC can take exploration actions as desired during Prepare Campsite and Camping Activities. Since these are GM fiat, they aren't implemented on the sheet. Simply open the character sheet and roll the checks manually, choosing the appropriate modifiers
  • Fatigued is not applied automatically since automating would more than likely be annoying and there are too many feats and meals to keep track of that change the duration to become fatigued.

Camping Activities

  • Camp Management: There is no concept of sequential activities
  • Cook: RAW, each meal is prepared by a separate cook and ingredients are expended before rolling the check. Currently, only one cook is supported who cooks all of the meals after camping activities are done
  • Relax: Depends on sequential activities and, since this action can be taken by everyone and depends on the order, only a Relaxed camping effect is available in the Camping Effects compendium. If you wish to, you can create a custom activity for each PC and give it the Effect UUIDs of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-camping-effects.Item.QvR2yvuIVQuztCwQ]{Relaxed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-camping-effects.Item.zliIP2agG0TVwKV4]{Relaxed (+1 to next campig check)} and Effect Target Self which handles all of the automation
  • Provide Aid: Roll this one as a separate check from your character sheet and apply the circumstance bonus for the roll separately
  • Exploration Activities: Activities that can be taken by more than one PC such as Exploration Activities are not supported since they require a different way of tracking time and have no clear way of automating them. You can execute these directly from your PC's sheet instead

Eating

  • Starvation & Fatigue are not tracked

Meals

  • All meals are automated as much as possible but you will need to manually take care of:

    • Reducing Conditions: Can not be done automatically because it is not 100% clear whether you are even allowed to reduce a condition. For instance Encumbered adds the Clumsy 1 condition but reducing it after consuming a meal is almost certainly wrong. The same applies for Curses.

    • Apply damage: There are no 2e system APIs that allow you to deal damage without a token

  • The following traits are lacking from their effects because the 2e system does not support traits on effects. These are important for spells and items that remove conditions limited to these traits such as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.SUKaxVZW2TlM8lu0]{Cleanse Affliction}:

    • Poison:

      • Baked Spider (Critical Failure)

      • Broiled Tuskwater (Oysters Critical Failure)

      • Grilled Silver Eel (Critical Failure)

      • Haggis (Critical Failure)

      • Hearty Purple Soup (Critical Failure)

      • Mastodon Steak (Critical Failure)

      • Onion Soup (Critical Failure)

      • Omelet (Critical Failure)

      • Seasoned Wings And Thighs (Critical Failure)

      • Smoked Trout And Hydra Pate (Critical Failure)

      • Succulent Sausages (Critical Failure)

      • Sweet Pancakes (Critical Failure)

    • Curse:

      • Black Linnorm Stew: (Critical Failure)

      • Supernatural Mince Pie: (Critical Failure)

      • Rice-N-Nut Pudding: (Critical Failure)

Upgrading from versions prior to 2.0.name: Upgrading from versions prior to 2.0
Upgrading from versions prior to 2.0.text:
This version marks a departure from Paizo's CUP to pure OGL and includes a complete overhaul of the camping sheet. Some changes require manual intervention

Manual Migration Steps

You will need to migrate somet things manually, namely:

  • Disable companion kingdom activities if needed

  • Enable additional uses for Magic in the sheet settings if needed

  • Rename regions from Zone XX to their Paizo IP equivalent in the Camping Sheet region config

  • Manually configure any previously overridden region playlists in the region config

Removal of CUP Content

I was already overhauling the camping sheet when Paizo announced the removal of the CUP license back in July 2024 (which was later reversed). Since I've been wanting to resolve licensing issues when combining CUP and AGPL content for quite a while now, this was a perfect opportunity to go OGL only.

This required me to scrub any mention of Paizo IP from the module, including the module name itself, which is now Kingdom Building, Camping & Weather. This should also clear up confusion that I've seen many times about whether you need to the official or unofficial module.

In almost all instances, functionality was kept intact by simply renaming offending content. However, there are 2 exceptions to this:

  • I do not ship companion actor statblocks anymore that weren't previously included. This was more of a maintability issue since the core system changes frequently and automation is not automatically migrated most of the time. Also, the Remaster didn't help

  • The Kingdom Sheet lost automation for appointing companions as leaders. Previously, the sheet automatically toggled the invested checkbox and enabled their features and activities when they were placed in the correct slot. This required override toggles in the settings to undo automation. It was a choice between keeping the old system and renaming the companions (e.g. Cleric Companion 1, Cleric Companion 2) or streamlining it. Now, everything works the same: you need to manually toggle the invested checkbox and enable companion activities like every other disabled activity

  • The Camping Sheet no longer ships Influence/Discover activities for each companion due to similar issues. I don't think Influence Cleric 1 would have been a paritularly useful thing.

Kingdom Sheet

  • There is no special automation for appointing compansions as leaders anymore. Instead, you whitelist their activities like all other activities under the Manage Activities button in the Turn tab. You will need to manually toggle the Invested checkbox. Some companions provide benefits that need to be enabled in the settings instead. You might need to enable/disable their companion activities or invested flags after upgrading

  • Some activities have been renamed (the temple and lily leadership activities) and might need to be manually disabled/enabled

  • Mentions of Paizo IP in Kingdom Events and Kingdom Activities have been removed or reworded

Camping Sheet

  • Region names are Paizo IP so you will need to configure all Region names manually in the camping region settings. If you have the official module enabled, Combat Tracks & Roll Tables will be prefilled.

  • Some Recipes mentioned Paizo IP. Most of them have been simplified by simply removing the offending name. The following recipes were changed:

    • Broiled Oysters

    • Supernatural Mince Pie

    • Ragout

    • Giant Scrambled Egg

    • Berry Pie

    • Oysters

    • Omelet

  • All Influence and Discover activities have been removed. However, you can now configure a DC per Skill when adding custom camping activities, allowing you to fully stat out the entire array of Influence/Discover checks

Journal Entries

  • Many entries were removed since they were duplicated in the sheets anyways and removing Paizo IP was work intensive

Tokens

  • All GMG NPC mappings have been removed to prepare for the arrival of NPC Core. Imported actors should continue to work, but there will be no image when browsing the Compendium Browser

New Feature: Camping Sheet Overhaul

  • When a new camping sheet is created, it automatically makes all players owners of the sheet to avoid permission issues and displays a quickstart manual to get you going

  • The sheet now calculates Hexploration Activities and allows you to advance or retract a single activity. You can set a minimum speed in the sheet's settings to mimic travel using horses.

  • Camp locations can now be tracked on a hex map. Choose a Hexploration Scene in settings to enable it. The party token position on the map is persisted after Prepare Campsite and will ask you to reuse an existing camp (if one exists). This uses a naive implementation of simply checking token coordinates changing the hex grid will require you to clear existing positions.

  • You can now configure all regions, including their combat tracks and types. New terrain types like Urban and Dungeon have been added to allow you to use the sheet in non hexploration campaigns as well

  • You can now configure the climate in the module settings, allowing you to set custom weather for each month

  • Combat Tracks can now reference a track in addition to a playlists

  • All combat tracks are now configured solely in the Camping Sheet. You don't need to create tracks with special names anymore and existing region tracks are ignored.

  • Companion activities that don't require a check can now be toggled in the camping sheet. This helps keeping the sheet clean and performant if you want to simulate travel with all companions

  • All recipes have been automated as much as possible. The only thing that was not possible to automate was applying damage (no 2e system APIs for that) and the reduction of conditions because those depend on context (e.g. can't reduce Clumsy when Encumbered or conditions from curses). This will post messages and damage to chat to apply them manually

  • Each PC can now choose more than one meal (RAW) but there is still only one designated cook as opposed to RAW.

  • Meal effects are now removed when preparing camp (RAW)

  • Subsist is now fully automated as a macro @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-macros.Macro.0NhBWcZQf1GHp73f]{Subsist: Provisions}. This macro adds Privisions items to an actor's inventory which get consumed before rations and is removed after resting

  • Similarly, there is now a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-macros.Macro.7MrkVVB6D6UrdtA1]{Create Food} macro that adds Provisions to the party actor. Use this to automate spells such as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Mt6ZzkVX8Q4xigFq]{Create Food}. You can also set a minimum subsistence in the settings to automatically gain this amount after resting.

  • Changing the degree of success dropdown for activities as well as recipes posts all associated messages to chat now

Upgrading from versions prior to 3.0.text:
The 3.0 release partially supports V&K 1.1. rules and required some changes to settings and to how leaders are handled in a kingdom sheet:

  • All Kingdom Leaders must now link to an NPC or Character actor; a best effort migration is in place which tries to find an NPC or Character actor by name. This might not work if your leaders don't have actors or if the names don't line up perfectly; to change existing leaders, simply drag and drop an actor from the sideebar onto the leader position in the sheet

  • Kingdom settings are now local to your kingdom sheet. This means that if you are running multiple instances, changes won't propagate to other sheets anymore

  • Roll Table UUIDs are now used for kingdom and cult events. This means that roll table names are not required to be unique anymore

生存DC @Check[type:survival|dc:25|traits:secret]（专家）

需求 暴风雪仅能在冬季期间内发生。

描述 结合了暴雪与狂风的天气显着地降低了能见度与温度。

准备 @Check[type:survival|dc:21]（受训）注意到天气恶化或者@Check[type:nature|dc:25]（专家）正确解释当地野生动物的行为。

流程（+8小时） 在暴风雪的持续时间，能见度降低到@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-weather-effects.qc5NAt3xu8sumqEh]{视觉的察觉检定承受-4环境罚值}的程度。风暴的效果在暴风雪期间内也生效，并且该地区温度下降至严寒。一旦暴风雪开始，无庇护的角色每小时受到[[/r 2d6]]寒冷伤害。在暴风雪期间，一次@Check[type:survival|dc:25]检定足以找到庇护所以避免因暴露而受到额外寒冷伤害，但每次尝试这样做需要花费1小时。

一旦暴风雪结束，旅行穿越该区域时将其视为困难地形，持续的天数等同于使得暴风雪结束的纯骰检定的数量。

Cold Snap (Hazard 1).text:
生存 @Check[type:survival|dc:16|traits:secret]（受训）

需求 寒潮会发生了除了夏天以外的任何时间。

描述 气温明显下降，在一年的同一时期内显得异常寒冷。

准备 @Check[type:nature|dc:19]（受训）或@Check[type:survival|dc:16]（受训）来意识到天气即将发生变化。

流程 （24+小时） 温度降至异乎寻常的低点。在春秋两季期间，气温转为轻度寒冷。在冬季期间，气温转为严寒，在此期间，无庇护的PC们每小时受到[[/r 1d6]]点寒冷伤害。如果一场暴风雪发生在寒潮期间，暴风雪的温度将降低至极寒，在此期间无庇护的PC们每10分钟受到[[/r 2d6]]点寒冷伤害。

Flash Flood (Hazard 7).name: 山洪（危害7） Flash Flood (Hazard 7)
Flash Flood (Hazard 7).text:
生存 @Check[type:survival|dc:27|traits:secret]（专家）

需求 PC们在一个包含丘陵、山脉或者河流的地块。

描述 上游或者山区深处的强降雨会导致突如其来的洪水顺着山阶或是沿着干枯的河床奔腾而下。

准备 @Check[type:survival|dc:21]（受训）在山洪奔袭前转移至高地

流程（1+小时） 汹涌的洪水以惊人的速度席卷了这一区域。PC们以察觉或者生存检定投掷先攻；投掷[[/r 1d20+17]]来确定山洪的先攻。在PC们的回合，他们可以尝试移动出洪水的路径。这可能简单到使用行走动作就能离开，也可能复杂到必须成功通过一个@Check[type:athletics|dc:25]检定来爬到安全地带。

你也可以通过设置洪水区域的宽度而让逃脱变得更为复杂，甚至达到三次行走都不足以逃脱的程度。在山洪的回合，它会尝试冲扫（Sweep Away）所有没有逃脱其路径的PC。被冲扫的角色能够以一次成功的@Check[type:athletics|dc:25]检定来逃离洪水，这是一个持续三轮的交互动作，他们能够游到岸边，或是抓住露出的树枝或是其他坚固物体；否则，PC们将持续地被一轮又一轮地冲扫。

一旦山洪结束，留下的河水还会持续数个小时、甚至是数天，这取决于你的判断。

冲扫 Sweep Away 3 山洪冲扫了所有没有逃离其路径的角色。每个角色都被带到200尺的下游（他们能以一次成功的@Check[type:athletics|dc:30]检定游泳来避免），并且受到[[/r 6d6]]点钝击伤害（@Check[type:reflex|dc:25|basic:true]豁免）。

描述 一开始是倾盆大雨，然后开始变得古怪起来，一些莫名其妙的东西开始从天而降：烈焰、酸雨、甚至像是蛙雨或是彩色玻璃的碎片这类的玩意

生存 @Check[type:survival|dc:27|traits:secret]（专家）

需求 PC们在一个不具有明显丘陵或山脉的地块。

描述 颜色奇怪或是形状不详的云团通常预示着一个独特的漏斗云将要到达该地区。

准备 @Check[type:survival|dc:35]（大师）来掌握如何在没有现成庇护所的情况下为应对龙卷风作出最好的准备。

流程（1+小时） 当龙卷风降临时，漏斗云将会造成惊人的破坏。虽然龙卷风的影响范围相对有限，但是预测龙卷风在其短暂而又充满破坏力的生命周期中会向何处移动是相当困难的。地下的室内空间可以作为应对龙卷风的庇护所，但在地面上寻求庇护所的角色仍然处于危险之中。龙卷风在该区域中持续的每个小时里，尝试一次@Check[type:flat|dc:16]检定（对每一个位于地上庇护所的PC）或@Check[type:flat|dc:6]检定（对每一个完全未受庇护的PC）。在该检定成功后，该PC将暴露在龙卷风或是它抛出的碎块中，并且必须尝试一次@Check[type:reflex|dc:32]豁免。

大成功 该角色成功避开了龙卷风及其碎块。

成功 该角色会因抛出的碎块受到[[/r 4d6]]钝击伤害和[[/r 4d6]]穿刺伤害，但他们将会避免该龙卷风在这一小时的剩余时间内将会造成的伤害。

失败 该角色会因抛出的碎块受到[[/r 8d6]]钝击伤害和[[/r 8d6]]穿刺伤害，并且在下一轮中，他们必须再次以豁免对抗龙卷风的效果。

大失败 如同失败，但是该角色还会被卷到空中，并向一个随机方向抛飞出120尺，在坠落中受到额外的[[/r 60]]点钝击伤害。
